sections.heading: API Rate Limiting
sections.content: Implement rate limiting to prevent abuse and ensure fair usage. Common strategies include token bucket, sliding window, and fixed window algorithms. Return 429 Too Many Requests with Retry-After header.

sections.heading: Kubernetes ConfigMaps - Configuration
sections.content: ConfigMaps store non-confidential configuration data as key-value pairs. They can be consumed by Pods as environment variables, command-line arguments, or configuration files in volumes.

sections.heading: Input Validation - Security
sections.content: Validate all user inputs on both client and server sides. Use allowlists, sanitize data, and implement proper encoding. Protect against SQL injection, XSS, and other injection attacks.

sections.heading: API Error Handling - Error Handling
sections.content: Return consistent error responses with HTTP status codes, error messages, and error codes. Use standard formats like RFC 7807 Problem Details or custom JSON structures with timestamp and request ID.
